data.title: Great food, music, people
data.text: A fun place to go! I've been here a few times and really liked everything I've ordered. Food and drink specials are very reasonably priced. Good mix of people, and friendly owners and staff. I rate it two paws up!

data.title: Awesome!
data.text: I was there on a Friday and had the fish sandwich...AMAZING! Great cocktails...great environment...great food! Well done Dogs Paw...I am looking forward to another visit..SOON!

data.title: Love Dog Paws
data.text: I love the atmosphere, the owners and the food in Dog Paws. They have a great bar, great hostesses and the owners personally greet all guest. The food is flavorful and good.

data.title: Friendly Newer Downtown Restaurant
data.text: This restaurant has very friendly staff and a good menu. The food that we had was great and the prices are reasonable. I've only been here once but was impressed.

data.title: Nice setting, great people, food gets mixed reviews
data.text: Staff is very friendly and kept an eye on us, asking if we needed anything more.  My burger was okay but too much bun for the size of the patty.  Bun was dry.  Others said their food was good and raved about the sweet potato fries.  Nice selection of beers; iced tea was awful (tasteless).

data.title: First Timers--very impressed with service
data.text: It was nice to see both of the owners WORKING, as it helped to make our experience very nice.  The atmosphere was great--casual, and the menu was tavern food with a twist.  Their triple smoked burger--WHOOHA! Delish!  Others ordered the blackened fish sandwich--very good, except for one where it was "too hot." Both owners stopped by the table, and made every effort to makes things right for us.  They were wonderful! We had a surprise visit by our niece, nephew and their three tykes--no problem! Nobody batted an eye, they got more tables for us, and the server made a special effort to make a fabulous "kiddy-cocktail."....oh yeah, one more thing--they have GREAT hot dogs too!

data.title: date night
data.text: Sat. night dinner- OUTSTANDING service! good food and drinks, really attentive service! shared service as apparently a few missing employees but never felt ignored ;-)

data.title: Great for a night out in downtown Elgin
data.text: Dog's Paw is truly a gem in downtown Elgin. The owners are very friendly and genuine people who will come out and talk to you during your meal. The wait staff are great and accommodating. Food is very unique and the chef does a wonderful job of preparing and presenting it. The best part of course is the wide variety of local brews they offer.

data.title: Great atmosphere, great food and drinks
data.text: Had a lovely time here and will be back in the future, just haven't had a chance. I recommend this place highly.

data.title: LUNCH
data.text: food was amazing!!!!!  My husband and I split the pretzel with spicy guiness cheese soup and the corned beef and cabbage sandwich!! WOW!!!!!!

data.title: very friendly staff
data.text: I am not a beer drinker, but I went with people who were and they were impressed by the choices of beer.  The menu is limited but the food is good.

data.title: Excellent intimate adult atmosphere
data.text: We stopped by for drinks/dessert. Customer service was great. Met the owners who were sweet and friendly. Food for real people. Glad we gave it a second chance as the atmosphere was intimate yet inviting.  Loved their trio of bunless burgers, tater tots with puuled pork, and deep fried twinkie type dessert. Just amazing. Cant wait to try their chimichangas- heard they were excellent!

data.title: Super Busy
data.text: We went there for the annual pub crawl and found it to be beyond busy.  I did not enjoy the atmosphere but hope it was just the event.  Will try it again without such an event going on.

data.title: Dissapointing Brew Pub
data.text: This is a place I was rooting for to come into Elgin and make it great, but yet again, another place that falls on its face. The service is extremely slow and poor, for a small restaurant/bar with a limited menu, this make its even more dissapointing. The food is overpriced and not very good. The burgers that are noted to be better than your average ground beef, were dry, even at medium rare, which came out more like medium well. I will gladly go down the street to Prime Burger for a huge, well made burger and fries, for the same price. Beer menu is good, but again, overpriced. I do hope things change and prices and attitude are more in line with the area, if they do not, this place will not last more than 6 months, though i think there is another year or close to it on the lease, from what I have read in the past.

data.title: New in the neighorhood..
data.text: It was a nice surprise to come across this new pub in downtown Elgin. The interior was very nice.....brick on walls and high ceilings.  Menu was limited but plenty to choose from.  My husband had a large gourmet hotdog and I had a pulled pork sandwich with steakfries.  We both enjoyed our meals. Prices were reasonable.  Beer selection was decent.  Atmosphere was lively even for a weeknight.  Place is family friendly early in the evening.  A nice neighborhood pub to stop into.  Would come back again.

data.title: very busy
data.text: very busy the last time i walked by. i hope u can visit. the food was very tasty and they have a lot of beer.

data.title: Drinks turned into dinner!
data.text: This new establishment has success written all over it! We met friends here for drinks with the intention of dining at another downtown Elgin restaurant. A tamed down menu with unique sandwiches offers some really delicious fare. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, and it was excellent. Definitely will order again! My wife had a burger that she raved about. The locally sourced selection of craft beers is balanced to please most aficionados. Bottled beer, wine and a full bar will please the others. Owner Isrial (a long time East Sider, spent much of the evening pressing the flesh and offering sincere gratitude to each patron for giving his new establishment a try was truly refreshing. He is a very likable nice man who practically single handedly built the comfortable interior space, bar & tables, and did a superb job of it. I highly recommend that everyone give Dog's Paw a chance!

data.title: Vegetarians beware!
data.text: Meat with meat topping. If you love meat, this is the place to go. Simple menu--everything on it is unique and excellent. Easy to read and understand. Tried the sausage with pulled pork and coleslaw dog. Yes. They did that. And it was good. My wife had a hot dog with bacon wrapped around it. Also excellent.  Have fun arteries!

data.title: Great new craft beer and burger/dog place in downtown Elgin
data.text: Check it out on the opening day. Tried the Maplewood (Ginger beer) draft from Logan Square and enjoyed a juicy turkey burger. I can't wait to return to try their Mexican Dog and sample some of the craft bottle beers (Southern Pecan will be my next).
